revised_title: The Effect of Oxygenated Blood on the Production of Glycosuria
tldr: The author investigates the effect of oxygenated blood on the liver and discovers that injecting defibrinated arterial blood into the portal system can induce glycosuria. This suggests that oxygenated blood may play a role in the transformation of amyloid substance into sugar, which is the foundation of artificial diabetes following operations on the nervous system.
